intro: Xylopia acuminata, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a tropical plant belonging to the Annonaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in regions such as Nigeria and Uganda. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and oval-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. The botanical features of Xylopia acuminata make it identifiable in both its natural habitat and in botanical gardens.
